course.title: Deutsche Romantik: Zwischen Fragmentierung und Heilung
course.description: Examines the fragments and (w)holes of romantic literature, focusing on the productive tension between forms of decomposition, dismemberment, wounding, on the one hand, and ideas of ideality, unity, healing, on the other. Includes a study of conflicting traditions of romantic criticism and their preferences for either fragmentation or wholeness. Authors include Novalis, Brentano, Gunderrode, Hoffmann, Arnim, Heine, as well as other key figures of the Goethezeit such as Holderlin, Jean Paul, Kleist.
course.notes: Readings in German, discussions in German and English.
